title.narrative: GGP3 Landscapes 2020-2022

description.narrative: Indonesia is well underway to achieve its NDC emission reduction commitments by reduced and avoided deforestation and peatland degradation in resilient landscapes, and able to adequately respond to calls for increased ambitions.

The project supports the GoI’s institutions and processes to mainstream NDC commitments into development plans and policies, leverage investment in REDD+ mitigation actions, and strengthen the capacity of key institutions and actors. GGGI will work at national level and in six focal provinces, including three of the four provinces with large remaining areas of intact forest; two with extensive peatlands; and one with the first province-wide, jurisdictional program for REDD+ results-based payments. The project directly addresses six of NICFI’s seven objectives and will assist Indonesia to progress from the second to the third phase of REDD+ (from implementation of national strategies and demonstrations to results-based actions).

mailing-address.narrative: Global Green Growth Institute, 19F Jeongdong Bldg., 21-15 Jeongdong-gil, Jung-gu Seoul 04529 Republic of Korea

title.narrative: Co-funding for ID05 - Climate Action Enhancement Package: Indonesia. Policy instruments under a jurisdictional approach are designed to reduce risks and enable better investment-related decision making and performance monitoring of forest and land based mitigations.
